revised_title: Moine-Dalradian Boundary and its Palaeotectonic Significance in the Scottish Highlands
tldr: This article examines the Moine-Dalradian boundary in the Scottish Highlands, which marks a significant change in lithological character. The authors review regional geochemical data and recent geophysical compilations to investigate the role of the pre-Caledonian 'Old Moine' complex in the evolution of the Highland region. The study suggests that the Moine-Dalradian boundary played a crucial role in the sedimentary, metamorphic, magmatic, and metallogenic evolution of the Caledonian orogen from late Precambrian to early Devonian times.
